title: Arts Illustrated - October/November 2015 (gnv64)
description:
Arts Illustrated - October/November 2015
English | 132 Pages | True PDF | 28.8 mb

We live in a world today where we are constantly bombarded by artificial sounds â€“ cell phones ringing, televisions blaring, live streaming, elevators singing, traffic snarling, advertisers pleading... the list is endless, if we stop to really listen. But, if we are really going to stop to listen, then we might as well go beyond this veil of superficiality and tune in to the sounds of nature that created us and continues to nurture us.
And that is why this issue on â€˜Sound in Artâ€™ became necessary, especially today. It became necessary to understand where beauty gets its rhythm from; it became necessary to understand where silence gets its resonance from; and it became necessary to understand that hearing and listening are not just two very different things, but two very different worlds.
